gift_source:
::MC1::
What is the main purpose of a local descriptor?
{
= To represent a feature for matching and recognition
~ To compress an image
~ To remove noise
~ To balance colors
}
title: MC1
question: What is the main purpose of a local descriptor?

choices.text: To represent a feature for matching and recognition

gift_source:
::MC2::
Which descriptor is known for high robustness but high cost?
{
= SIFT
~ SURF
~ ORB
~ FAST
}
title: MC2
question: Which descriptor is known for high robustness but high cost?

gift_source:

~ FAST
~ MSER
}

question: Which descriptor was designed as a faster approximation of SIFT?

gift_source:
::MATCH1::
Match the descriptor to property.
{
= SIFT -> Gradient histograms
= SURF -> Faster SIFT approximation
= ORB -> Binary descriptor
= All -> Feature matching
}
title: MATCH1
question: Match the descriptor to property.

gift_source:
::MATCH2::
Match the acronym to meaning.
{
= SIFT -> Scale-Invariant Feature Transform
= SURF -> Speeded-Up Robust Features
= ORB -> Oriented FAST and BRIEF
= SLAM -> Simultaneous Localization and Mapping
}
title: MATCH2
question: Match the acronym to meaning.

gift_source:
::MATCH3::
Match the descriptor to drawback.
{
= SIFT -> Slow
= SURF -> Less distinctive than SIFT
= ORB -> Less robust to large scale changes
= All -> Sensitive to extreme illumination
}
title: MATCH3
question: Match the descriptor to drawback.

pairs.right: Less robust to large scale changes

gift_source:

Match the descriptor to advantage.
{
= SIFT -> Robustness

= All -> Feature matching
}
title: MATCH4
question: Match the descriptor to advantage.

gift_source:

Match the descriptor to application.

}
title: MATCH5
question: Match the descriptor to application.

gift_source:
::MATCH6::
Match the descriptor to data type.
{
= SIFT -> Floating-point vectors

= ORB -> Binary vectors
= All -> Feature descriptors
}
title: MATCH6
question: Match the descriptor to data type.

gift_source:
::MATCH7::
Match the requirement to property.
{
= Distinctive -> Differentiates features
= Robust -> Works under noise
= Compact -> Efficient representation
= Invariant -> Stable under changes
}
title: MATCH7
question: Match the requirement to property.

gift_source:
::MATCH8::
Match the step to descriptor.
{
= Compute gradients -> SIFT
= Use Haar wavelets -> SURF
= Binary intensity test -> ORB
= Build feature vector -> All
}
title: MATCH8
question: Match the step to descriptor.

gift_source:
::MATCH9::
Match the detector-descriptor pair.
{
= FAST -> ORB
= MSER -> Region descriptor
= Harris -> Corners
= SIFT -> Scale-invariant features
}
title: MATCH9
question: Match the detector-descriptor pair.

gift_source:
::MATCH10::
Match the challenge to effect.
{
= Noise -> Descriptor errors
= Scale change -> Matching issues
= Rotation -> Orientation differences
= Illumination -> Reduced distinctiveness
}
title: MATCH10
question: Match the challenge to effect.
